messages.content: As an AI assistant, my role is to meticulously analyze criminal justice documents and extract information about law enforcement personnel. The response will contain: 1) The name of a law enforcement personnel. The individual's name must be prefixed with one of the following titles to be in law enforcement: Detective, Sergeant, Lieutenant, Captain, Deputy, Officer, Patrol Officer, Criminalist, Technician, Coroner, or Dr. Please prefix the name with 'Officer Name: I will derive this data from the following paragraph: CASE NAME: The Midnight Manuscript Mystery DATE: 07/07/52 The courtroom awaited the testimonies with bated breath as the trial commenced. The prosecution invited the officers who were integral to the investigation to the stand. LAW ENFORCEMENT TESTIMONY: PROSECUTOR: Please state your name and role in the investigation. WITNESS: I am Captain A. B. Adams, the lead investigator in this case. PROSECUTOR: Thank you, Captain Adams. Could you elaborate on the sequence of events on the night the manuscript was discovered missing? WITNESS: Certainly. On the night of January 13th, Officer C. D. Barnes reported the disappearance of the valuable manuscript from the library. We began the investigation promptly. PROSECUTOR: Who took on the forensic analysis? WITNESS: Sergeant E. F. Clark and Technician G. H. Davis were tasked with the forensic examination. PROSECUTOR: Who managed the interrogations? WITNESS: Detectives I. J. Evans and K. L. Foster handled the interrogations of the library staff and potential witnesses. PROSECUTOR: Thank you. No further questions. The Defense then started a cross-examination of Captain Adams regarding the investigative procedures employed. Throughout the trial, Patrol Officers M. N. Gray, O. P. Harris, and Q. R. Ingram were also called to testify.
Identify each individual in the transcript, by name, who are directly referred to as officers, sergeants, lieutenants, captains, detectives, homicide officers, and crime lab personnel.
